com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.subordinate

Interface Condition

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCompare, AbstractCondition, And, Equal, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual, Match, Not, NotEqual, Or

    public interface Condition
extends Serializable
    This interface marks condition functions that evaluate to true or false. Examples of condition functions include "equal", "and", "or", "not" etc.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Martin Shevchenko, Jonathan Austin

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isFalse()
      Indicates whether this condition evaluates to 'false' in the given context.
      boolean isFalse(Request request)
      Indicates whether this condition evaluates to 'false' in the given context by testing the value in the Request.
      boolean isTrue()
      Indicates whether this condition evaluates to 'true' in the given context.
      boolean isTrue(Request request)
      Indicates whether this condition evaluates to 'true' in the given context by getting the values from the Request.

    • Method Detail

      • isTrue

        boolean isTrue()
        Indicates whether this condition evaluates to 'true' in the given context.
        Returns:
        true if this condition evaluates to 'true', otherwise false.

      • isFalse

        boolean isFalse()
        Indicates whether this condition evaluates to 'false' in the given context.
        Returns:
        true if this condition evaluates to 'false', otherwise false.

      • isTrue

        boolean isTrue(Request request)
        Indicates whether this condition evaluates to 'true' in the given context by getting the values from the Request.
        Parameters:
        request - the request being processed.
        Returns:
        true if this condition evaluates to 'true', otherwise false.

      • isFalse

        boolean isFalse(Request request)
        Indicates whether this condition evaluates to 'false' in the given context by testing the value in the Request.
        Parameters:
        request - the request being processed.
        Returns:
        true if this condition evaluates to 'false', otherwise false.
